settings.heading: What this test measures.
settings.content:
-Estradiol

-Cortisol

-Dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate (DHEA-S)Insulin

-Thyroid-stimulating hormone, or TSH, is a hormone produced by the pituitary gland that is responsible for controlling the production of the thyroid hormones T3 and T4 by the thyroid gland. The hormone TSH is considered the most sensitive marker for screening for thyroid diseases and conditions.

-Thyroid peroxidase (TPO) antibodies are antibodies that can bind to thyroid enzymes, suppressing thyroid function. If TPO antibodies are elevated, this could be suggestive of an autoimmune condition.

-Free T3: Levels of T3 fluctuate when individuals have an under- or overactive thyroid gland. This test measures free T3, the free (not bound to protein), and biologically active form of the hormone.

-Free T4: Levels of T4 fluctuate when individuals have an under- or overactive thyroid gland. This test measures free T4, the free (not bound to protein), and biologically active form of the hormone.

settings.heading: Who should get tested
settings.content:
If you are showing any symptoms of Hypot/hyper active thyroid (underactive) then this test is the best place to start! Common symptoms of thyroid disease overlap with normal signs of aging, making it difficult to detect without testing. Symptoms of thyroid disease can include:Â 

Thinning hair

Irregular, slow or rapid heartbeat

Muscle weakness

Tremors

Joint pain

These insights into your thyroid health can be used to engage a healthcare professional and follow-up with treatment for any issues found. This may include; reducing stress, iodine supplements, medication, exercise plans and dietary changes.

settings.heading: Collection method - Finger prick sample
settings.content: Our kits require just a few drops of blood from the fingertip, a clinically-validated method that is just as accurate (and typically less painful) than conventional blood collection. Afraid of needles? The needle on our lancet stays hidden until collection is complete.
